AggregatedAlertRef.description: Metadata about an aggregated alert that belongs to a parent alert bucket.

created_at.description: The time the child alert was created.

doc_type.description: The document type of the child alert.

has_analysis.description: A boolean indicating if the child alert has analysis or file attachments.

id.description: The ID of the aggregated chid alert.

monitor_id.description: The ID of the monitor that generated the child alert.

status.description: The status of the child alert.

tags.description: The tags of the child alert.

AggregatedAlertRef.title: Aggregated Alert Reference

Alert.description: An alert is created for each monitor that has at least one matching condition. The alert includes details and context regarding the (raw) document matched, the topics/labels matched from the monitor, as well as the labels and topics identified within the (raw) document.

aggregated_added_at.description: Only applicable to alert buckets, this field is the timestamp at which the most recent child alert was aggregated into the bucket.

aggregated_alert_count.description: Only applicable to alert buckets, and indicates the number of alerts aggregated into this bucket alert.

aggregated_alert_count_new.description: Only applicable to alert buckets, and indicates the number of alerts with new status in this bucket alert.

aggregated_alerts.description: Only applciable to alert buckets, this field contains metadata about each child alert aggregated into this bucket.

aggregated_under_id.description: Only applicable to child alerts that are aggregated into a bucket, this field is the ID of the parent bucket alert.

analysis.description: If analysis has been added to the alert, then this property contains the analysis text.
analysis.example: Sample analysis text and can be markdown format.

attachments.description: File attachments associated with the alert as part of the alert's analysis.

created_at.description: The time this alert was created at.

doc_matches.description: Any document matches generated for this alert.

doc_url.description: The URL to the document that triggered this alert.

email_sent_at.description: If email notifications are used for this alert, the timestamp the alert email was sent.

has_analysis.description: True if the alert has analysis text or file attachments and false otherwise.

label_matches.description: Any labels that matched for this alert.

labels.description: The labels itentified in the document that triggered this alert.

labels_url.description: The URL to the labels identified in the document that triggered this alert.

meets_password_policy.description: If the monitor that created the alert includes a password policy, this value indicates if the alert (when applicable) has a password that meets the policy.

monitor_id.description: The ID of the monitor that generated this alert.

monitor_name.description: The name of the monitor that generated this alert.

monitor_version.description: The version of the monitor that generated this alert.

relevance_class.description: The relevance class suggested for this alert.

relevance_probability.description: The relevance probability suggested for this alert.

tags.description: The tags set for this alert.

topic_matches.description: Any topic matches the monitor generated for this alert.

topics.description: The topics that were identified in the document that triggered this alert.

topics_url.description: The URL to the toics identified in the document that triggered this alert.

updated_at.description: The time this alert was last updated at.

Alert.title: Alert

AlertAnalysisOp.description: The analysis text for an alert. This can be in markdown format.

analysis.description: The analysis text that can be in markdown format.

AlertAnalysisOp.title: Alert Analysis Operation

AlertAuditRecord.description: Metadata regarding an operation performed on an alert.

alert_id.description: The ID of the alert that was operated on.

history_created_at.description: The time the operation was performed.

id.description: The ID of the audit record.

monitor_id.description: The ID of the monitor that created the alert.

operation.description: The operation performed on the alert.

previous_status.description: The status of the alert prior to the operation.

to_status.description: The status of the alert after the operation.

user_email.description: The username that performed the operation.

user_id.description: The ID of the user that performed the operation.

AlertAuditRecord.title: Alert Audit Record

history.description: The list of alert audit records.

AlertBulk.description: Request body for bulk alert operations.
AlertBulk.title: Bulk Alert Request

AlertBulkApplyOp.description: The changes to apply to alerts meeting the query criteria.

add_tags.description: Tags to add on any alerts updated. Duplicate tags will not be created on any alert.

exlcude_ids.description: If provided, an array of alert IDs that should be explictly skipped during the update operation.

remove_tags.description: Tags to remove on any alerts updated.

status.description: The status to apply to the alerts.

AlertBulkApplyOp.title: Bulk Alert Apply Operation

AlertBulkOp.description: An alert bulk operation to apply in a bulk request.

status.description: The status to set for the alert.

tags.description: The tags to set for the alert and will replace any existing tags on the alert.

AlertBulkOp.title: Bulk Alert Operation

Condition.description: A Condition forms the basis for querying topics and labels in monitors. It can be used to form complex conditions using all/any as well as specifying specific values to match for documents. See the user guide for more details.

match.description: The match values, or sub Conditions.

operator.description: The operator to use for this Condition.

topic.description: The topic to apply this Condition to.

Condition.title: Condition

Doc.description: A ingested/indexed raw document including thet topics and labels created from the doc by our Analytics processing.

labels.description: The labels identified in the raw document.

labels_url.description: The URL to the labels for this document.

topics.description: The topics identified in the raw document.

topics_url.description: The URL to the topics for this document.

Doc.title: Raw Source Document

Doc_match.description: A Doc Match represents the doc query that was matched for a monitor alert.

locations.description: A list of locations for the match.

match_path.description: The JSON field path of the match.

Doc_match.title: Doc Match

DocSearchResponse.description: Response body for a document search. If if timed out, the search request can be scoped using date ranges.

docs.description: The list of raw documents found in the search.

timed_out.description: If true, the document searching timed out and the query should be scored with a date range.

total_docs.description: The estimated number of documents that matched the search.

DocSearchResponse.title: Document Search Response

email_address.description: The email address of the recipient.

status.description: The status of the email address verification.

verification_sent_at.description: The timestamp an email verification was sent at for this email address.

recipients.description: The list of email addresses for receipients.

created_at.description: The timestamp this email setting was created.

delivery_times.description: The delivery times specified for scheduled emails.

frequency.description: The frequency at which scheduled emails are delivered.

id.description: The ID of the email settings.

timezone_location.description: The timezone location to use for scheduled emails.

updated_at.description: The timestamp this email setting was last updated.

Entity_location.description: The location of a Topic (entity) identified within a (raw) document

element_path.description: The JSON field path at which the entity was found in the raw document.

offsets.description: The list of offsets where the entity was found in the element_path.

Entity_location.title: Entity Location

content_type.description: The content type of the file attachment.

created_at.description: The time the file attachment was created.

created_by_user_id.description: The user ID that created the attachment.

filesize_bytes.description: The size of the attachment measured in bytes.

id.description: The ID of the file attachment.

name.description: The file name of the attachment.

Label.description: A Label identified within a (raw) document.

classifier.description: The classifier that identified this label.

confidence.description: The confidence estimate that the label was identified properly.

element_path.description: The JSON field path in the raw document where the label was identified.

version.description: The version of the classifier that identified this label.

Label.title: Label

Label_match.description: Indication of a label matching a monitor condition for label topics

label_id.description: The ID of the identified label that was matched.

value.description: The label value that was matched.

Label_match.title: Label Match

Labels.description: A list of labels that have been extracted from a document by our analytics processing.
Labels.title: Labels

Location.description: Location represents a text location as specified by its start and end index and its matching value.

offsets.description: The offsets in the raw document where the value was identified.

Location.title: Location

Monitor.description: A monitor defines 1 or more conditions and an optional doc query string to use for matching documents of interest. Matching a document results in the creation of an alert.

created_at.description: The timestamp the monitor was created.

created_by_user_email.description: The user's name that created the monitor.

created_by_user_id.description: The ID of the user that created the monitor.

email_notify_enabled.description: If email notifications are enabled for this monitor.

email_notify_immediate.description: If immediate email delivery is enabled for this monitor.

enabled.description: If the monitor is enabled or not.

last_updated_by_user_id.description: The ID of the user that last updated the monitor.

last_updated_user_email.description: The user's name that last updated the monitor.

template_id.description: If a monitor was created from a template, then this field is populated with the template's ID. It cannot be changed after creation.

updated_at.description: The timestamp the monitor was last updated.

version.description: The version number for the monitor. A monitor's version is incremented each time the monitor is updated.

Monitor.title: Monitor

MonitorBackfillEstimate.description: An estimated count of alerts that will be created when backfilling a monitor.

alert_count.description: The estimated number of alerts that will be created when backfilling alerts for the monitor.

MonitorBackfillEstimate.title: Monitor Backfill Estimate

MonitorTemplate.description: Monitor templates provide suggested monitor conditions based on top DTM use cases.
MonitorTemplate.title: Monitor Template

MonitorTemplates.description: A list of monitor templates for top DTM use cases.
MonitorTemplates.title: Monitor Templates

length_max.description: The maxium length of the password in order to meet the policy.

length_min.description: The minimum length of the password in order to meet the policy.

lowercase_char_count.description: The minimum numer of lowercase characters a password is expected to have in order to meet the policy.

lowercase_char_required.description: If true, then the password is expected to have lowercase characters in order to meet the policy.

numbers_count.description: The minimum numer of numerical characters a password is expected to have in order to meet the policy.

numbers_required.description: If true, then the password is expected to have numerical characters in order to meet the policy.

special_char_count.description: The minimum numer of special case characters a password is expected to have in order to meet the policy.

special_char_required.description: If true, then the password is expected to have special case characters in order to meet the policy.

uppercase_char_count.description: The minimum numer of uppercase characters a password is expected to have in order to meet the policy.

uppercase_char_required.description: If true, then the password is expected to have uppercase characters in order to meet the policy.

Topic.description: A topic identified within a (raw) document

confidence.description: The estimated confidence that the value was properly idenitified.

entity_locations.description: The locations of the identified entities.

extractor.description: The name of the extractor that identified the topic value.

id.description: The ID of the identified topic.

value.description: The value identified for the topic.

Topic.title: Topic

Topic_match.description: A topic match indicates which search and topic was matched for a monitor alert.

topic_id.description: The ID of the topic corresponding to this match.

value.description: The value of the topic that matched.

Topic_match.title: Topic Match

Topics.description: A list of topics extracted from a document by our analytics processing.
Topics.title: Topics

VerifiedDomain.description: A verified domain proves ownership of domain and is used for authenticating login credential visibility for Compromised Credential alerts.

challenge.description: The DNS TXT record challenge code that's used to verified domain ownership.

created_at.description: The time the verified domain was created.

created_by.description: The user name that created the verified domain.

created_by_user_id.description: The user ID that created the verified domain.

domain.description: The domain name. Must not be a free email provider domain.

id.description: The ID of the verified domain.

primary_domain.description: The primary domain extracted from the domain name. e.g. the parent domain.

status.description: The status of the verified domain with respect to its proven ownership.

updated_at.description: The time the verified domain was last updated.

updated_by.description: The user name that last updated the verified domain.

updated_by_user_id.description: The user ID that last updated the verified domain.

verification_checked_at.description: The last time the DNS TXT record was checked for verification.

verification_message.description: A explaination pretaining to the last time the TXT record was checked for the verification code.

verification_type.description: The type of verification used for the domain.

VerifiedDomain.title: Verifeid Domain

VerifiedDomainOp.description: A verified domain proves ownership of domain and is used for authenticating login credential visibility for Compromised Credential alerts.
VerifiedDomainOp.title: Verified Domain Operation

VerifiedDomainOps.description: A list of verified domains to add.
VerifiedDomainOps.title: Verified Domain Operations

info.description: The Digital Threat Monitoring (DTM) API provides programatic access to Mandiant's DTM capabilities.
info.title: DTM (DIGITAL THREAT MONITORING)

parameters.description: Your API key
parameters.name: x-apikey

parameters.description: The alert field name to sort the response alerts by.
parameters.name: sort

parameters.description: The order used to sort the response alerts field by.
parameters.name: order

parameters.description: The number of alerts to return in each page. Max value of 25.
parameters.name: size

parameters.description: Only return alerts for the given monitor ID. This parameter can be specified multiple times to filter on more than one monitor ID.
parameters.name: monitor_id

parameters.description: If false, doc, labels, and topics are not returned in the response body.
parameters.name: refs

parameters.description: If true, then any links in the alert doc are sanitized and replaced.
parameters.name: replace_links

parameters.description: If true, then the monitor's name that created the alert is returned in the alert response body.
parameters.name: monitor_name

parameters.description: If true, then only alerts that have analysis are returned. An alert has anlysis if it has either analysis text or analysis file attachments.
parameters.name: has_analysis

parameters.description: If true, then alert buckets are returned for aggregated alerts. If false, then bucket format is not returned, but instead all child aggregated alerts are.
parameters.name: buckets

parameters.description: When listing alerts by date range, since defines the starting date in RFC3339 format
parameters.name: since

parameters.description: When listing alerts by date range, until defines the ending date in RFC3339 format
parameters.name: until

parameters.description: Only used when fetching subsequent pages during pagination and will contain a unique page ID. No other query parameters can be used with page
parameters.name: page

parameters.description: Truncates document fields to the given length using unicode ellipsis (\x2026) to indicate truncation
parameters.name: truncate

parameters.description: Filter alerts by their status. This parameter can be specified multiple times.
parameters.name: status

parameters.description: Filter alerts by alert type. This parameter can be specified multiple times.
parameters.name: alert_type

parameters.description: Search alert and triggering doc contents based on a simple Lucene query string including 1 or more text values separated by AND or OR.
parameters.name: search

parameters.description: If specified, then only alerts that have the given match value are returned. This parameter can be repeated multiple times.
parameters.name: match_value

parameters.description: Filter alerts by tag(s). This parameter can be used more than once to filter on multiple tags.
parameters.name: tags

parameters.description: When using the search parameter, its value can be base64 encoded in which case search_encoding indicates the value encoding type.
parameters.name: search_encoding

parameters.description: Return alerts that have the given severity. This parameter can be repeated multiple times.
parameters.name: severity

parameters.description: If true, any HTML content in the alert is sanitized to ensure it does not potentially contain malicious tags. If not used, be careful when rendering/using the alert/doc content. This param can also be specified as a json path in the alert document to sanitize and may be repeated in this case.
parameters.name: sanitize

parameters.description: Filter alerts with mscores greater than or equal to the given value.
parameters.name: mscore_gte

Content-Type.description: The content type of the response body.

Link.description: If another page of results is available for pagination, the Link header will contain the URI used to fetch the next page.
